comment:
Did get the caramel and it is sweet after being hand warmed. 

Tasted at j&m
Bit boring whisky. Not to bad, but id rather have a JD with my coke

Edit: I’m bumping him up to 3.5 from 2.75, I’m having it again after experiencing more peat, and I am appreciating the hint of smoke in this guy more now. Very smooth, good sweetness, hint of smoke sets it off. Good stuff. 
It’s definitely peaty, but not much. I would drink a full pour for sure, but I was just able to have a sip.
Buttery, smooth. Caramel on the nose.
Overwhelming raisins, I will revisit this later but for now it is going in the back of the liquor cabinet. Regular price around $50 CAD, I much prefer the American Oak for the same price.
Slight oak, peat and fruit on the nose, slight sherry and toffee on the palate, short oaky and spicy finish
Similar notes to 3 wood but not as complex. Sweet. Cinnamon. Honey.
Sweet with a nice smooth finish.  Much easier to handle than the scotch I used to sneak as a kid.
Fort alcool, peu de caractère et de complexité

Nose: sweet, slight fudge smell. 
Taste: Sweet, hints of caramel. Maybe some herb/spice notes.
Short/medium long finish, easy sipper. 
Leaves a pleasant sweet taste.
Pretty simple whiskey. Toffee nose. Sweet finish.

Very smooth and welcoming. Nice hints of fruit and toasted cereal, almost like that from Lucky Charms on the nose. Mostly vanilla and caramel notes on the taste with a hint of coconut on the lingering finish

Nose:  Cheerios.  

Palate:  Flowery, oily, barley, flowery

 Finish:  Lingers, palate hits you a second time

Very pleasant and easy to drink.  Adding water kills what’s “neat” about the whisky, but very drinkable.
I love the toffee notes with hints of smoke and caramel.

First Lowland scotch ive had. Had Famous Grouse smoky black in my hand and thought...every time I buy a blended scotch I bitch about the grain alcohol so I put it back and got this. Glad I did. Poured neat, nose is a melon bomb. Cantaloupe mainly but some honeydew as well. Holiday spices , sweet malt and honey as well, all very fresh. Palate delivers on the nose with a punch of malty melon with some spicy zest and gentle oak. Has some mandarin notes too as listed on bottle. This is a wonderful unique single malt! Finish is long with all the fruits hanging on with the malt, spice and honey oak. The oak does build through the dram. No off notes or bitterness arrive leaving a warm pleasant aftertaste. This is not a heavy hitter at 80 proof yet the flavors while thin are not lacking. Its on the lighter side(kinda Irish like) of the spectrum but anyone who enjoys scotch or Irish should give this a go............86/100.....easy drinking spicy and fruity delight.
More depth than the 3, shorter note, enjoyable
Sent super bon mais un peu trop piquant! Se rapproche du Macallan. Bien avec un repas salé. Au London Jack
Tropical fruits with sweet notes of caramel, vanilla

Well, that’s Auchentoshan for sure and I wonder if I should add anything to that as these Lowland malts are truly distinctive to anything you can get from the market.
The aroma has this sour/bitter carcass based on arrow-wood berries, lemon zest and some chemicals like nail polish or acetone which is the feature common to all of the Auchentoshan malts. Some of the components are similar to the ones of Three Wood but much less intense though the 12 yo has a pretty solid body itself. Also some raisins, prunes and plum jam to form the sweet yet pale shape.
The taste is sour sweet again - arrow-wood berries, red bilberries, both honeysuckle and honeyberries, blackcurrant leaves mixed with a newly-mown grass, citruses, raisins, caramel and a black pepper shade on a back of the tongue.
The finish is malty and a little bitter with many wooden/grain notes. Also some seasonings like thyme and coriander show up right before the taste completely vanishes from your mouth.
It really is closer to the fabulous Three Wood then to its “predecessor” - American Oak - thanks to the 12 years spent in the sherrie oak. Chemicals and polish just step aside here handing the leading role over to berries, caramel and raisins.

Pas mal mieux que mes souvenirs ! Pas mal plus smooth ! Nettement mieux. Je crois que mes papilles ont évoluées depuis ! ;)
Essayé chez R. Laflamme en 2019-12.

Nose: woody
Taste: Vanilla, sweet, smooth, light
Finish: oak, caramel

Cooked caramel on the nose, with a hint of baked bread heavy on the vanilla

Oily mouth feel and mild spice going down

Affordable and tasty for new comers - highly recommend.
Smooth and easy drinking. On the sweet side for Scotch but a nice drinker and would be a good gateway Scotch.
Spicy on the tongue but sweet going down. Easy drinker.
Better then American oak version. Vanilla, honey and flowers in the nose then oak and honey in the taste.
Nose of caramel and some dark fruit? First sip shows a little honey and toasted almonds. A few drops of water opens and smooths it out. Very drinkable.
Nice flavour. Medium bodied, good flavour.
Bit oiley. Strong woody tones. Herbal
Very smooth, floral with a note of honey. Bright finish floral note blending into citrus. Light water, pair with a lighter cigar or pipe
The nose is hard for me to get past. Unfortunately triple sec (used in some margaritas) has ruined this one for me.
Nutty, and earthy notes, mild,floral notes.
Malt, little sweetness. Quite boring taste.
strong cherry and floral notes, substantial and maybe slightly oily mouthfeel for such a light whisky, long and warm finish

Boğaza doğru bir karamel / toffee tadı
Sherry kokusu
Turunçgil-mandalina veya portakal

On the nose is a little dim, but you get Sweet aromas like honey, Plum, caramel and Lemon

Very Pleasant flavor, woody, nutty flavor. Caramel is also present. Finish is medium, pleasant. I love sweet whiskies, and this is a great one.

I really enjoyed this dram, very recommended
Nice smooth scotch highlands like with a little hint of smoke and vanilla and dried fruit subtle
Fruity nose. Sweet smooth body. Bloody drinkable

Auchentoshan 12 is one of those bottles that will forever be on my bar. It's inoffensive to new whisky drinkers and there's never a bad time to enjoy it as a veteran. It is just too easy to enjoy (unless you're hoping for puch-in-the-face peat). Aged in bourbon and sherry barrels, this mild dram offers a slight citrusy and toffee flavour that doesn't overstay its welcome. 8.5/10.
Very fresh. Honey, toffee, citrus and floral on the nose. Cinnamon spice, almond and vanilla on the taste and finish.
Very smooth dram. Nice tropical fruits that’s slightly toasty.
Sweet, vanilla. Slight smoke on finish. Solid but not superb
Predominantly smokey nose but a little floral note. Big floral and spice flavors. Like this one a lot. Easy sipper and delicious!
Easy sipping. Light, fruity, short finish. No peat.
Musty wood funk and honey aroma and flavor.  Burned tires on the finish.  The more I havr the more I get burned tires.  Blech!

Nose: hongzao, dried figs, chocolate, sweet floral, honey
Palette: light peat, fig, orange peel/bitters. Toffee with aeration
Finish: short, primarily peat, black pepper
A little sweetness and a little smoke. Definitely getting heavy sherry on the finish. Not exciting but not bad.
smooth and mellow. Great choice for sipping

Smoke, coconut, rich, toffee, caramel.
Water: brings out the floral notes.

Nose: sweet, vanilla, almond, but also some fruitiness, mostly lime. Palate: still sweet, like vanilla pudding, but also oaky bitterness, faint smoke, and some spicy notes, like ginger, anis, and mint. Medium finish. Adding just a few drops of water lengthens the finish.
Strong and bitter. Too much peat
floral and citrus on the nose; toffee, bright orange and smoky licorice; soft and warm finish
Fruity with a hint of smoke
